PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Equiv.continuous_symm_iff`
`+ Equiv.isOpenMap_symm_iff`
`+ piCongrLeft`
`+++ piUnique`
`+++ sumPiEquivProdPi`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I don't really want to merge this at the moment because of this unexpected twist where a continuity proof that was `by fun_prop` now involves a random new declaration `Equiv.continuous_symm_of_isOpenMap` which we may even have in some other form already.

In other words: this PR has had a new declaration added since it was delegated so I'm reluctant to go ahead with the merge until someone else signs it off.

Thanks!

bors d+
Probably these should have `@[simps]`, especially if the existing weaker ones in mathlib do.

```suggestion
def pUnitPiEquiv (f : PUnit → Type*) : (∀ t : PUnit, f t) ≃ f () where
```
I think this is more readable for a mathematician eye (I would even argue for Pi-notation but most of this file already uses forall).
Same remark for all flavors of `pUnitPiEquiv`

Am I going crazy? `(Π t : PUnit, f t)` gives me an `expected token` error on the `\Pi` in this file so that's probably why this file isn't using it! I agree that \Pi is best, it looks like a product (and indeed is a product). In the other files it seems to work fine.
You're not going crazy: [PiNotation.piNotation](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Util/Delaborators.html#PiNotation.piNotation) is simply not imported yet!
"homeomorphic and isomorphic" sounds a bit weird to me, what about "topologically isomorphic" or just "isomorphic" ?
How about "isomorphic (both topologically and algebraically)"?
I think in functional analysis "topologically isomorphic" means "isomorphic as a topological vector space", but being more explicit never hurts.

```suggestion
/-- The product over `S ⊕ T` of a family of topological modules
```
Isn't this [`Equiv.piUnique`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Equiv/Defs.html#Equiv.piUnique)?
This is fine for my application so I've switched everything over to this (which makes the name of this branch a bit weird but never mind)

nit:
```suggestion

end Pi
```

```suggestion
/-- The product `Π t : α, f t` of a family of topological modules is isomorphic
(both topologically and algebraically) to the space `f ⬝` when `α` only contains `⬝`.
```

How about making this an `Iff`?
```suggestion
lemma Equiv.continuous_symm_iff (e : X ≃ Y) : Continuous e.symm ↔ IsOpenMap e := by
  simp_rw [continuous_def, ← Set.image_equiv_eq_preimage_symm, IsOpenMap]

lemma Equiv.isOpenMap_symm_iff (e : X ≃ Y) : IsOpenMap e.symm ↔ Continuous e := by
  simp_rw [← Equiv.continuous_symm_iff, Equiv.symm_symm]
```

You should probably use these lemmas to golf

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5bf0f3993d81f682aab73c6129b25b49da7144fa/Mathlib/Topology/Homeomorph.lean#L426-L435

too
Perhaps we should use `homeomorphOfContinuousOpen` directly here, though the new lemmas are still nice to have.
This breaks the `fun_prop` proof, which I've replaced with a call to `continuous_apply`.

pullRequest.title: feat: add sumPiEquivProdPi and pUnitPiEquiv

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Probably these should have `@[simps]`, especially if the existing weaker ones in mathlib do.

I don't really want to merge this at the moment because of this unexpected twist where a continuity proof that was `by fun_prop` now involves a random new declaration `Equiv.continuous_symm_of_isOpenMap` which we may even have in some other form already.

In other words: this PR has had a new declaration added since it was delegated so I'm reluctant to go ahead with the merge until someone else signs it off.
